common.Mp: Full-stack with a front-end focus: polished interfaces, strong performance, and a mobile-first UX. I also build the backend end-to-end (APIs, authentication, and data) when needed.
common.Ap1: I’m a full-stack developer (frontend-focused) with a product mindset. I build polished interfaces with well-measured animations/micro-interactions and a mobile-first UX, keeping performance and code quality as top priorities. My main stack is Next.js/React + TypeScript.
common.Ap2: I’ve been coding since 2021, and over the last few years I’ve worked on end-to-end projects: UI design and implementation, workflow and business logic, API integrations, authentication/authorization, and data modeling. I value strict typing, reusable components, and maintainable architecture—backed by testing so changes don’t break critical flows.
common.Asubt: Take a close look at my most recent projects
common.Cp1: I'm available for full-time positions and freelance jobs. Contact me and let's chat!

resume.p2: Full-stack developer (frontend-focused) with experience building web applications using React/Next.js + TypeScript. I design components, state, data fetching, and routing, and extend into the backend when needed (APIs, auth, and persistence). I prioritize clear contracts between layers, strict typing, and a development workflow with linting and tests (unit/integration + E2E) to prevent regressions.
resume.l1: Build process of a e-wallet with React that uses Metamask to sign transactions, Ganache as blockchain, a simulated ERC20 token as currency, Truffle as compiler for contracts and Babel for translating to react (since '.js' files were used)
resume.l2: Creation of an ERC20 token with changed decimals
resume.l3: Calibration and repairing of active and passive devices of Telecentro.
resume.rselectric2: This project was developed using Wordpress and a theme as the base design, which was then modified to the client's liking.
resume.rselectric3: It features several functionalities and security measures such as anti-malware protection, some SEO implementations, automatic emails, and spam prevention.
resume.ots2: This work features several functionalities and implementations, as well as complex design polygons that calculate their shape automatically.
resume.ots3: Implementation of Google Maps JavaScript API to create an overlay map superimposed on the United Kingdom, this map has custom markers and popups.
resume.ots4: Integration with Howler.js to handle sound and create an audio player with complete features (Play/Pause, Next, Previous, Shuffle, Repeat, and Repeat one).
resume.ots5: It makes use of the latest features and optimizations of Next.js such as server components, image placeholders, dynamic imports, etc. to achieve fast loading and efficient operation despite its large amount of content and interactions.

selectedProjects.name: Eventify
selectedProjects.subtitle: Full-stack events platform (Next.js + TypeScript + Prisma)
bullets: Role-based experiences (admin/organizer/user) with auth and permissions.
Full CRUD, search/filters + pagination, RSVPs, and email reminders.
Mobile-first UI focused on performance, accessibility, and micro-interactions.
Testing: unit/integration + E2E to prevent regressions.

selectedProjects.name: UpTask
selectedProjects.subtitle: Project and task management with collaboration and realtime sync (MERN)
bullets: REST API with JWT, email confirmation, and password recovery (SendGrid).
Projects/tasks/collaborators data model on MongoDB (Mongoose) with creator/collaborator permissions.
Real-time project task synchronization via Socket.IO (rooms + events).

selectedProjects.name: Cafe
selectedProjects.subtitle: Ordering system + kitchen queue (Next.js + Prisma)
bullets: Café ordering app built with Next.js (App Router): category menu → cart → confirmation, submitting orders via API Routes.
Kitchen/admin dashboard with a pending orders queue and completion flow (no sockets; updates via SWR polling).
Persistence with Prisma + MySQL: Category–Product catalog and Order model with JSON orderDetails plus total/state.

selectedProjects.name: GuitarLA
selectedProjects.subtitle: Guitar shop + blog (Next.js + Strapi)
bullets: E-commerce + blog frontend built with Next.js (Pages Router) using dynamic routes for products and posts.
Content fetched from Strapi (REST) via API_URL, populate=image for media and URL-based filters; SSG for listings/product detail and SSR for blog detail.
localStorage-persisted cart with quantity/removal controls and order summary; images via Next Image + Cloudinary.

education.name: Udemy
education.subtitle: React + TypeScript — Complete Guide
bullets: React + TypeScript: core hooks (useEffect / useMemo /useCallback/useReducer), custom hooks, and state patterns (Context + Zustand).
Forms and validation: React Hook Form + Zod; API consumption and type-safe practices.
Next.js 14: App Router + Server Actions; Prisma integration and full-stack foundations (MERN/PERN).

education.name: Coderhouse
education.subtitle: Web Development (JavaScript)
bullets: Capstone: React e-wallet with Web3 integration (MetaMask) and local chain setup with Ganache.
ERC-20 smart contracts with Truffle (token + decimals configuration).

resume.selfLearningNote: Self-directed learner: continuous learning through official documentation and end-to-end projects.

wallet.paragraph: This app was created with React, it uses Metamask to sign transactions, Ganache as blockchain, Truffle as compiler for contracts and Babel for translating react (since '.js' files were used). The wallet allows you to make and receive transactions of an ERC20 token which I built, called USDTM (USDT Mock)  a token that has the same decimals as the USDT.

rs-electric.paragraph: Corporate website for the company 'RS Electric LLC.' in Las Vegas developed using Wordpress and 'Builty' theme as design base, this theme was highly customized to meet the client needs. The site has a firewall, security against malware, automatic backups, Cloudflare's Turnstile to prevent spam, google analytics, a base for the implementation of SEO and email configuration with automatic response.

portfolio.paragraph: Portfolio designed and created with Next.js 13.4.1, integrated with Framer Motion and Tailwind CSS, featuring dynamic project display, animations, context, and form, connected through Github with Vercel.

old-time-sailors.paragraph: Artistic | corporate website for Old Time Sailors LTD., featuring integration with the Google Maps API for ticket mapping, Howler for its custom music player, and complex styles. It uses Next.js 14, Strapi, PostgreSQL for its functionality.

kiosk.paragraph: Project with various coffee shop items that uses SWR to send updates of pending orders to the kitchen, and Prisma to manage the database.

guitar-la.paragraph: Guitar store with blogs and courses, integrated with a shopping cart that uses Local Storage. Created with Next.js and a variant with Remix (the remix link is on Github).

uptask.paragraph: Network of users and projects with the ability to add collaborators to tasks and projects. Includes login, signup, authorizations, JWT encryption, verification/confirmation email, and socket.io for real-time updates. Created with the MERN stack along with Mongoose.

crypto-quoter.paragraph: This app uses an API to show the value of the selected cryptocurrency in the selected currency and provides other data.

budget-control.paragraph: App with a simple and effective system for controlling personal expenses across different categories with animations.

drinks-finder.paragraph: Website for searching different types of drinks and their recipes using a drinks and cocktails API, , The Cocktails DB. Created with Vite, React, and Bootstrap for styling, Axios for API calls.

crm.paragraph: CRM for managing clients and CRUD operations.

news-api.paragraph: Application that uses the News Catcher API to bring the latest news along with a category filter.

react-redux-crud.paragraph: Project created to learn CRUD operations using Redux, making use of Actions, Reducers, and Types. Sweet Alert for alerts.

car-insurance-quote-calculator.paragraph: Simple insurance calculator that uses a base price to calculate insurance prices depending on the car's characteristics.

appointments.paragraph: Patient appointment book for a Veterinary clinic.

weather-app.paragraph: This project allows checking the real-time weather in cities across six different countries through an API.

ts-blog.title: TypeScript Blog
ts-blog.paragraph: Blog built with Next.js and Sanity as a CMS, featuring a responsive Tailwind UI. Built in ~2 weeks as a practical project to transition from mostly JSX to TypeScript and solidify typing, components, and data fetching.

eventify.title: Eventify
eventify.paragraph: A full-stack event discovery and management product built with Next.js App Router, Clerk, and Prisma/PostgreSQL, delivering distinct admin, organizer, and attendee experiences. I built it as a TypeScript deep dive with strict end-to-end typing (no 'any') and clear contracts across the UI, API, and database layers. The core prioritizes time consistency with timezone-aware logic for agenda and 'today/upcoming' ordering, using derived local date keys to sort correctly in the viewer's timezone. It includes RSVP flows with uniqueness rules and reminder preference synchronization, plus cron-driven email delivery using React Email templates. For UX and performance, it combines Motion One micro-interactions, tilt/3D cards, and WebGL backgrounds with fallbacks that honor 'prefers-reduced-motion'. The project is backed by a complete unit/integration + E2E test stack (Vitest + Playwright) to keep critical flows regression-safe.
